title: feat: react native > 0.71.x support and Expo
body:
small edit: there might be some cleanup to do as we do not use JSC or Hermes directly so we can likely omit some checks there in the `CMakelist.txt`.

tested with:
  - expo 48 + RN 71
  - RN 71
  - RN 69
  - RN 68
  - RN 66 (needs a minor change in the android/app/build.gradle, this is relevant for bifold). 


# for RN 66 support:

in android/app/build.gradle

```diff
-    implementation "com.facebook.react:react-native:+"  // From node_modules
+    implementation "com.facebook.react:react-native:0.66.2"
```

or 

```diff
+ def REACT_NATIVE_VERSION = new File(['node', '--print',"JSON.parse(require('fs').readFileSync(require.resolve('react-native/package.json'), 'utf-8')).version"].execute(null, rootDir).text.trim())

-    implementation "com.facebook.react:react-native:+"  // From node_modules
+    implementation "com.facebook.react:react-native:" + REACT_NATIVE_VERSION
```

title: feat(js): allow custom native bindings for RN
body: Allows the user the supply custom native bindings to the reactnativeariesaskar class. This is done to make it easier to add support for Expo in the future.

title: chore: lower iOS compatibility
body:
- Use static libraries for iOS for lower version compatibility
- Use rust 1.61.0 in CI as hashbrown needs 1.61.0 minimum.

title: fix(js): scan fetch record limit
body:
There is an unnecessary chunk variable (inherited from previous Indy SDK implementation in AFJ) that is preventing `fetchAll` to retrieve all records when they are more than PAGE_SIZE. As a result, a given Scan cannot return more than 32 entries.

Simply checking for `listHandle` (`scanNext` return value) validity seems to be enough to determine if there are no more matching records.

title: fix(nodejs): compatible with Windows builds
body: closes #131

title: fix(js): defer library loading for nodejs
body:
Prevent native library from being loaded right when `@hyperledger/aries-askar-nodejs` is imported by deferring its loading to when it's actually used. 

This is a problem we found during AFJ test suites, which import the library in general purpose test helpers and make the native library to be loaded more times than needed, allocating more memory and making the suite to crash.

title: chore: update version

title: feat(js): added migration to wrapper
body:
- chore: updated header and generation
- feat(js): indy-sdk to askar migration
- fix(js): fixed the nodejs tests
- test(js): added small migration tests and mock wallet

Sadly I had to copy the `.db` file instead of moving it in the test. For some very odd reason, which can be debugged later, if I moved it inside the tests I would get an `AEAD decryption error`. It is a slight overhead that should be fine for now.

title: fix(js): key handle name
body: There was a small inconsistency between the key handle name for `keyFree` between node.js and react native. As all other methods use `localKeyHandle` (which the RN also expected), i've changed the method and node implementation.

title: Restrict default max conns to a range for sqlite
body:
Now using a default maximum number of connections between 2 and 8 even when the detected number of CPUs is higher or lower.

Related: #109

title: chore: update version to dev.4
body:
Updates the version to dev.4. 

We want to wait for a release until #111, #104, #108 & #89 are merged (which are mostly waiting for the broken CI)

title: fix(js): several fixes for js wrapper
body:
This PR contains several fixes from integrating aries askar into react native. 

Mainly it resolves:
- https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-askar/issues/77
- incorrect creation of errors in React Native (no AriesAskarError, but string)
- null pointer handling

Draft as it still needs to be tested fully in React Native

title: fix(js): ensure scan is freed after fetchAll
body:
When using `Scan.fetchAll` I found that the scan handle was not always properly freed. It turns out that this had to do with an error thrown when calling `scanNext` due to no records have been found (related issue https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-askar/issues/77), which prevented the code from executing the scanFree call.

So here we simply add a try-finally to make sure it is always being called.

title: fix(js): free key and entry objects
fix(js): empty key entry list metadata in react-native
body:
This prevents a crash  when fetching an existing key in iOS (and likely also in Android) and `askar_key_entry_list_get_metadata` returns NULL:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4800462/221714690-915db1cd-6f8b-43c1-b065-375bce0efdb7.png)

Not sure if the same should be applied to other parts of the code (it was already done in some other methods such as `entryListGetTags` and  `keyEntryListGetTags`).

title: feat: migration pre-upgrade script
body:
I added the [migration but not the conversion](https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-acapy-wallet-upgrade/blob/6494f068278d85accde2d066bc26f162489f5b57/acapy_wallet_upgrade/strategies.py#L745-L750) script to aries-askar itself. 

It is added as a feature (default right now, but can be removed). After a while we can probably remove it from the default features as most people have migrated, but then it can always be opted-in of course.

I was working on the migration script for React Native Sqlite wallets and I was running into a lof of issues regarding sqlite and cryptography dependencies. Every sqlite dependency came with a list of issues and it since we can not patch them (as the sqlite dependency has to be a direct dependency of the wallet), it seemed unfeasible.

I tried to depend on the values / structs / functions from aries-askar itself as much as possible, but I might have created some duplicate code. @andrewwhitehead you can probably spot this a lot better than me here.

The python script could also depend on this function, but it is not required.

The script also only supports indy-sdk sqlite -> aries-askar sqlite. There is no additional support for multiple wallets (although the script can be be called multiple times for this to work, however untested). Postgres has been omitted for now as it did not fit the direct use case. I don't think that adding support for Postgres would be all too complex.

Curious to hear if there are any objections to this PR or if there is a very specific reason why it was not done for the Python script.

cc: @TimoGlastra @andrewwhitehead @swcurran 

NOTE: It does not really have a test, yet. I would have to create an indy-sdk wallet and I am not too sure what the quickest way is to do that.

title: Build updates for manylinux support
body:
- Specify the base images used in `cross` builds
- Verify that Python wheels (and by extension npm modules) are compatible with manylinux 2014
- Only use build.sh (now build-universal.sh) for MacOS universal builds, otherwise prefer `cargo build`
- Improve caching of Rust dependencies
- Run unit tests in parallel with other tasks
- Fail on assembling xcframework if input files are not found

- Updates Rust crate dependencies

title: Add FFI method to terminate worker threads; fix custom logger disabling
body: In my tests this appears to fix the intermittent failures when terminating after running the Python wrapper tests.

title: better ios android build pipeline
body:
Dependent upon #84 

- update deprecated actions
- build(js): add the build steps for ios and android to the main build

title: feat(js): add Bls12381G1G2 to supported key algos
body: G1G2 variant of BLS12381 is supported by Askar but is not available in JavaScript wrappers. In this PR we add the constant to `KeyAlgs` enum.

title: Update deprecated github actions
body: Also updates to build with Rust 1.58.0 (required by the selected version of Cross, and sqlx 0.6)

title: fix(js): set scan offset to 0 if not defined
body: For some reason, JS wrappers were defaulting offset to -1. This throws an `OFFSET must not be negative` error when using a PostgreSQL backend.

title: chore(js): add @hyperledger prefix
body:
Adds the @hyperledger prefix to all js packages as [aries-askar-shared](https://www.npmjs.com/package/aries-askar-shared) is already taken.

It also updates the registartion of the native implementation to be automatic when you import the nodejs / react native as is done with indy-vdr.

It also sets the version in the package json to 0.1.0-dev.1 so we can make a first release.

@blu3beri is the React Native also ready for release? I think we still need the ios / android publishing to the release right? As the version is `–dev.x` and it's already integrated sort into AFJ I say we start releasing it under the official name.

title: Change behaviour of clause negation in tag filters
body: Fixes #74

title: Exposed Argon enum in Rust to use it for key derivation
body: Askar exposes `StoreKeyMethod` enum (it is used for wallet creation and opening) but for using `DeriveKey` variant we need to pass `KdfMethod` object which is crate private.

title: fix(js): Scan with more than a single result
body:
As discussed with @blu3beri lately, current implementation of Scan only works when there is a single result. This quick-and-dirty fix allows to retrieve all matching records from the query.

Note: To avoid further file name conflicts, this PR is based on https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-askar/pull/71, so it can be easily merged once that one is ready. Relevant file changes for this PR are those of commit https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-askar/commit/d08b728bd554316c966422317941593ee5a894bb

title: feat(js): add Store rekey
body:
Expose rekey on Store objects. 

**Note**: To avoid further file name conflicts, this PR is based on #71, so it can be easily merged once that one is ready. Relevant file changes for this PR are those of commit bb24dee81014e6e1f5f13df46d340fc501db1f16

title: feat(js): add wrapper to build pipeline
body:
Adds JavaScript wrapper to CI/CD pipeline, in a very much similar fashion to Indy VDR. Includes some minor fixes raised when running typing/lint checks.

It needs NPM_TOKEN to be added to the project config (I'm currently testing in my [fork](https://github.com/genaris/aries-askar/tree/feat/test-release) using test NPM package names).

Build pipeline was updated to match the one in indy-vdr, except of android/ios which is still handled in separate files (to be updated in #67) and Python wrapper for linux-aarch64 as it's throwing some errors that need further investigation.

When installed, Node.Js wrapper will retrieve, from Askar releases, the proper aries_askar binary. To determine the correct binary, it uses a script that provides the architecture to `node-pre-gyp` install script. This logic could be useful to indy-vdr-nodejs as well, as I've seen that it is not getting the correct file in all cases.
